title: How to Make Mini Cheesecakes

steps.headline: Organize.
steps.description: Organize the silicon liners into the muffin tins.

steps.headline: Blend the crushed graham crackers with the melted butter and granulated sugar in one big bowl.
steps.description: Then place them to the silicon liners and firmly squeeze them in the liners.

steps.headline: Blend the cream cheese, the granulated sugar, 3 eggs, and 1 tsp of vanilla extract.
steps.description: Then place them into the silicon liners with the graham crackers. Use  about 2 spoonfuls.

steps.headline: Baking time.
steps.description: Heat your oven for about 300°F (150°C) for 40 to 45 minutes. Then place them into a cool place.

steps.headline: After baking and cooling, try to make different varieties of flavors like cookies n' cream, blueberry, strawberry, etc.

text: Organize. Organize the silicon liners into the muffin tins. Blend the crushed graham crackers with the melted butter and granulated sugar in one big bowl. Then place them to the silicon liners and firmly squeeze them in the liners. Blend the cream cheese, the granulated sugar, 3 eggs, and 1 tsp of vanilla extract. Then place them into the silicon liners with the graham crackers. Use  about 2 spoonfuls. Baking time. Heat your oven for about 300°F (150°C) for 40 to 45 minutes. Then place them into a cool place. After baking and cooling, try to make different varieties of flavors like cookies n' cream, blueberry, strawberry, etc. (already found in the ingredients.) Enjoy your mini cheesecakes.
